author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1691513869}
review:
"Crashed Lander" ist ein kleines arcadiges Flug-Spiel.

Bereits im Jahre 1979 erschien "Lunar Lander". Ein Spiel, in dem wir ein Raumschiff mit der Hilfe von Schubdüsen durch eine bergige Landschaft steuern  und auf einem Landeplatz sicher landen müssen. Die Raumfähre ist dabei sehr empfindlich und wird zerstört, wenn wir gegen einen Berg fliegen oder auch mit zu hoher Geschwindigkeit aufsetzen. 

"Crashed Lander" steht klar in der Tradition von "Lunar Lander". Im Gegensatz zu seinem Urvater bewegen wir uns hier aber in der Third-Person Perspektive durch eine 3D Welt. Und wir müssen nacheinander auf mehreren Plattformen landen.

Das Spielprinzip funktioniert auch heute noch. Es ist gar nicht so einfach, den Lander mit den Schubdüsen zu steuern während uns die Schwerkraft ständig nach unten zieht.  

Es gibt zwei grundsätzliche Spielarten. Im klassischen Modus sollen wir auf Plattformen landen. Im Runner Modus müssen wir unseren Lander auch noch durch mehrere schwebende Ringe manövrieren. 

"Crashed Lander" macht kaum etwas neu, stützt sich auf ein Jahrzehnte altes Spielprinzip und bietet auch nicht allzu viel Abwechslung. Und doch funktioniert das alte Konzept. 

Grafik und Sound sind vor allem zweckmäßig, nicht schlecht, aber auf recht einfachem Niveau. Problematisch ist lediglich hin und wieder - trotz drehbarer Kameraposition - die Übersicht. Man kann leicht einen Felsvorsprung übersehen. 

"Crashed Lander" ist nichts Herausragendes, aber es ist einigermaßen solide. Und das alte "Lunar Lander"-Feeling funktioniert auch heute noch. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
6/10 Atmosphäre
-/10 Story
6/10 Grafik
6/10 Sound
7/10 Spielmechanik
6/10 Balancing
6/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
"Lunar Lander" in 3D.

[h1][b]6/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198007223119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1550421563}
review: Crashed Lander ist ein physikbasiertes Landespiel, wo man einen raketengetriebenen Lander mit dem Gamepad steuern darf. Die Grafik ist einfach gehalten und lenkt damit nicht vom eigentlichen Spiel ab, auch die Musik ist nicht direkt nervig. Die Steuerung basiert auf Ausrichtung und Schub. Das ist auch alles was man braucht, um durch Ringe zu fliegen oder auf Plattformen zu landen. Klingt einfach, wird aber durch den teils abgedrehten Levelaufbau erschwert. So muss man herannahenden Objekten ausweichen oder sich bewegende Plattformen annähern und natürlich auch dort landen ;) Auch ist man hin und wieder auf der Suchen nach versteckten Plattformen. Die Steuerung ist super präzise und schön direkt umgesetzt. Die 25 Plattformmissionen und 25 Ringstrecken sind die 4,99 Euro locker wert. Also meine Daumen hoch, Crashed Lander ist meinerseits voll zu empfehlen.

review:
Hey guys,
I found this game some time ago cause it was on PayWhatYouWant. When the trailer started to play a "wow this is cool!!' came out of me. Now with the global-leaderboard update I got the chance to do a restart of the game. (trying to beat the Dev Don for the highscore (-:  ) Make sure to read the instructions and tips, e.g. update to Beta via the shortcut in your steamlist and extra keys for you to look around and play the game in first person view. I don't have a VRset but this might be the reason to look into it... I hope it comes with anti-gravity pills tho... LOL
* Bonus - There is even a 5 level demo for you to try... Hope to see you on the leaderboards, make sure to wave when you pass me please! Greets from Holland ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198066590240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2800, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1648712520}
review:
Wasn't sure about this game from all the bad reviews, but it's quite the changeup from most VR games out there.  VR actually adds to the depth of the gameplay as you can better see the terrain and navigate your vehicle through the 360 labyrinth as fast as possible.  Your vehicle will explode if it takes too much damage.  I wish there was a way to know how much damage your vehicle has taken though.  It seems as soon as it starts smoking, it's about to explode.  

I do recommend this game, especially if you can get it at the current sale price of $2.49.  There's lots of levels to get stars in (like mobile games), but each level is pretty unique (some levels look the same, but have different challenges in them).  It runs smoothly and the different languages added make it quite unique (even the credits are done interestingly).  I played this game with xbox controller on Oculus Rift and I had zero problems.  Ran very smoothly.

Rating 7/10 considering the value here

review:
It's rather barebones but it's charming in its simplicity and has quite a few challenges to master if you enjoy that Pilotwings style gameplay of landing and going through hoops while you rocket your way through the levels as fast as you can for record times.

Visually the game has some interesting scenarios to plunge through with your propane powered piece of panzer so there's that to look forward to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041553741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1471197826}
review:
I started the game regularly via desktop icon and when it started, the option for rift showed up and I set it on, restarted as side by side on my monitor and not via my rift.
I tried to start it via Steam VR with the option play on oculus rift and steam started it as a side by side on steam virtual desktop. I've never been more annoyed in my life. Checked my games in Steam VR and it doesn't show up as a VR game. Maybe it's for DK1 and not CV1.
developer_response: I'm sorry that you had a frustrating time with the game. It does work with the Vive, but you currently need to opt-in to the v3 beta. This wasn't communicated very well in the game's description. I've added more info there that should help get the message across.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021880912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1466989230}
review:
This is a really good game.  Works on the Vive too, you just have to subscribe to the beta after installing (Otherwise it opens in theater mode)

I've bought a few $5 and less games and they basically are someones unfinished project, this is not, it's a full game that is really fun to play.  

The Vive usage is flawless (I know the creator doesn't have a headset, but you wouldn't know it)

Controls are great and you feel really connected to the game.  It's much better than a $5 game, don't know why he's selling it that cheap.  

For some reason on the hard mode, my Xbox controller does not work, it doesn't do anything.

What would be cool would be a leaderboard so we could compete for the best times.

review:
One of the worst games I've ever played.

Pros to this game are the controls work pretty well, the physics are alright. There seems to be a ton of levels that presumably get harder and harder, can't say for sure since I was bored away from this pretty fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026635388', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1605831196}
review:
Love this game. Imma play it a lot. I already got like, 15 hours into the game.

I want:
•more levels & hidden collectables.
•reasonably more difficult places/objects to manuver around
•A few more entities that interfere with your piloting skills, to a degree.

This game looks very different from other games, and has it's own style. But I wish it was more memorable, with an engaging atmosphere. Ya know? It needs a fitting setting, alike the ones you see in the sci-fi genre. But I'm glad it has it's own look

PROS:
^•^ Get this game for the thrill of crashing a rock with thrusters into things ... Or for the difficulty and satisfaction of piloting the most delicate dounut-box ship onto pads like a Mother@#$%ing boss.
^•^ You feel like casually floating onto small pads is easy and boring? There's a stop watch taped to your @$$ that will make you RUSH like HELL to beat the impossible times, while balencing between speed and control. Only true pilots can achive 3 stars on all 25 levels. There's also a Hard Flight Mode that changes the controls to make them impossible AND 45% more realistic. (a little too difficult maybe?)

CONS:
v.v The game is a little ugly, and it's obviously not for everyone. Opinions WILL vary, and I've seen people call this game hidious, and I can see where they're coming from. Not much to this game... BESIDES THE PROS!
v.v I sorta like it, and dislike the fact that you can go to ANY level you want.
(Resist the temptation of going to the last few levels. This game gets good.)
v.v You only get 3 stars for beating the best time? Why not 5? C'mon, make 2 stars the-easy-way & 5 stars 2 challenges drilled together.

Now YOU rate this game.
1 sterg = 0/10 dirt medel
2 stars = noob's bronze medal
3 stars = Silver Do-it-better Medal
4 stars = Gold Honor
5 STAR = Universal Recognition

Edit: Whoa, just played this in VR and holy crap, BEST experience I've had with this game. This is the kind of VR game you'll want to use the keybored for. (If ya wanna look down, just push your chair back a bit and put the keybored in your lap)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999839135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1600667548}
review:
Good ideas. Mediocre physics gameplay. Terrible presentation. 

The basic premise is solid. Using your Lunar lander, land on platforms in sequence as quickly as possible while trying to avoid collision damage which will make you explode. There are a lot of good ideas in the levels which vary from landing on moving platforms to flying through consecutive rigs, to finding hidden areas to navigating very tight spaces. Its enough to keep it realatively interesting. The downside is the camera which runs into issues in tigh spaces and the sheer pointless scale of the levels. In some levels the game has you traveling very long distances for no aparent reason. 

Where the game really falls off is the presentation. While the basic craft is quite functional, its visually uninteresting and has no clear front, back or sides. The majority of the levels are built from ambiguous shapes and poorly built random models that make no cohesive sense. The lack of clearly reccognizable scale elements makes it difficult to tell where you are, where you have been and how far things are at times.  

If you are a big fan of physics puzzles and lunar lander style games, its worth picking up on sale. For anyone else, I would avoid this game.

review: Anyone that owns a DK2 should buy this game, there is a definite wow factor and there is a lot of content!  Even if you don't have a Rift, this is still a fun game.  On normal mode the controls are tight and pulling off a fast level completion feels rewarding.  The hard mode is a challenge in a surgeon simulator kind of way that is even more fun to watch people play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060429182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1669555189}
review: I like it, I like the feel, the idea, I like the way it plays, very smooth and intuitively. The menu's look a bit old fashioned, but I guess that's all a bit on purpose. Only thing is that I would like to have lighter images and atmosphere, so that youactually see and feel it is all just for fun. I am not talking about dark ideas or gloomy storylines, on the contrary, there IS no storyline, which is perfect. No, I am talking about using dark colors and leteral darkness all the time, like all those places and planets used for background are always dark and you always need lamps to see something. Lighten up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056784959', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1529998229}
review:
小型宇宙船を操作するゲーム。
クソゲー臭がすごかったがなかなか面白い一品。
チェックポイントとなる円形のマットへ順番に着陸していくモードとリングを順番抜けていくモードの2種類。
それぞれに25面と20面用意されていてどれでも好きな面から遊べる。

とにかく宇宙船の操作が難しい。勢い良くぶつかると壊れるしマットへの着陸もゆっくりしないと壊れる。
ジェットエンジンで動くからあっちへ行ったりこっちへ行ったり安定しない。

ノーマルとハードの2種類が有りノーマルはやってれば何とかなる。
問題はハード、操作がキーボードのみとなりジェットエンジンを1つのキーで1個動かすようになる。
まともに飛ばないから頭が禿げそうになる。
エンジンは全部で6個ありノーマルはある程度緩和されてて簡単。

ちなみにデフォのハード設定でWSIJにキー設定されてると自分の環境ではエンジンが同時に使えなく飛ぶことができなかった。
2つをshift、ctrl、altに変えると使えるようになった。

author: {'steamid': '76561198168226218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1506280206}
review: Fun game. Best play with keyboard and mouse or gamepad. Starts off easy then gets harder. A lot of replayabilty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000683794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1425252427}
review: nice good looking pas timer .. but nothing else to do but to guide the craft .. basically it looks more like a demo for the VR gadget oculus rift !! . not a game so not recommend .. get it during sale for trading cards
developer_response: Thanks for your review, superZakootaPG. I'm curious why you feel that Crashed Lander is 'not a game'. There are specific goals to accomplish in both Pad Hopper and Ring Runner modes, high scores for every level, obstacles and challenges to overcome. I designed it to be more like classic arcade games than today's big, complicated games - but I feel that it definitely falls in the 'game' category.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968749489', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1512502535}
review: I've been playing this for hours before it went on Steam, but now it has been put there too it hopefully gets more people playing. It's a good casual game which has simple controls (k/m or gamepad) but takes skill to master and control your ship. Also, I like a lot of the in-game music too, and some levels I just enjoy replaying as the immersion is good if you have an Oculus Rift. I recommend this title, especially for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086457357', 'num_games_owned': 1222, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1653842942}
review:
Un jeu sympathique, ou vous pilotez une sorte de petit drone (vu à la troisième personne) sur une planète avec des plantes extra-terrestres au look exotique et assez jolies. L'aire de vol est limitée par une sphère, mais elle est assez grande pour un peu d'évolution libre, d'exploration et d'amusement. 

Le drone est assez fragile (les chocs sur le rocher le font assez facilement exploser) et il est assez parallépipédique avec une forte prise au vent, mais c'est aussi ce qui pimente le jeu et fait partie du fun. Le pilotage en mode normal est plutôt facile et fluide, mais les niveaux deviennent de plus en plus compliqués avec des atterissages dans des zones de plus en plus encombrées, ce qui vous force à rester sur vos gardes. Il existe aussi un mode difficile pour les masochistes.

La course contre la montre (pour obtenir une étoile supplémentaire sur chaque niveau) a des temps qui sont de vrais défis et demandent d'optimiser son pilotage à fond.

Bref, c'est un lunar lander 3d avec la physique du vol bien réalisée, de jolis paysages. Si vous pensez que ce genre de pilotage peut vous amuser, allez-y, ce jeu réussit bien cet aspect là.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080912666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1447038618}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970324812', 'num_games_owned': 5099, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1423733363}
review:
Fun game with some addictive challenges. Good mechanics and controls making your lander feel real. A unique challenge. All levels are accessable from the start so you don't get blocked if you cannot get through a tricky level.
The later levels have some fun with proceedural generatiion and it works pretty well. Would benefit from adding steam achievements - especially if they take into account which control mode you use.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018453230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1596, 'last_played': 1423345401}
review: For anyone who likes the idea of a 3D Lunar Lander, I can recommend this game. The objective is to pilot your small spacecraft / drone through different environments and land it on all of the landing pads of each level as quickly as possible.  The challenge is that you have to deal with gravity, environmental hazards, and landing pads that are sometimes camouflaged or obscured. Similar to the original Atari Lunar Lander, there isn't any combat and you don't ferry any cargo. The environments you pilot your ship through are varied and imaginative, and you can further challenge your flying skills by flying through rings in a type of challenge mode.  There is also a ‘hard’ mode that basically makes flying your ship a much more manual and hands-on process, as well as hidden objects to find throughout the game. For the modest asking price, there is a good amount of content. It doesn’t take too long to see everything, but a lot of the fun comes from the challenge of completing levels as quickly and as recklessly as possible. I feel this type of game appeals mainly to a niche audience, and if you fall into that niche this game is worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971440448', 'num_games_owned': 2657, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1423200751}
review: Fun and challenging take on the classic lunar lander type game.  Two game modes, two difficulty levels, and item collectables give it a fair amount of content for the price.  And Oculus Rift support, if you have one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039380801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1423069685}
review:
Nice game, there are about 50 different level which include jumping from platform to platform or flying through rings.

If you have a dk2, you can consider buying this game, although 5 Euro is no that cheap for a simple game like that, plus it is a little nauseating for me.

Still, props to the developer .
